headline: Horseradish Cream Sauce Recipe
description: Horseradish cream sauce is the perfect accompaniment for beef of all kinds, particularly roasts and steaks.

video.description: In this video, you'll learn how to make horseradish cream sauce at home. This video covers how to make a dipping sauce as the perfect Easter or Christmas side dish. Watch how horseradish cream sauce is created for the perfect accompaniment for beef, specifically roasts and steaks. Learn how to make horseradish cream sauce in just 45 minutes. This tutorial is beginner-friendly and simple to follow. This dipping sauce is a better alternative to jarred horseradish sauce from the store.
video.name: How To Make Horseradish Cream Sauce

name: Horseradish Cream Sauce Recipe
keywords: condiments, dips, horseradish, sauced, sauces, spicy
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup crème fraîche or sour cream
1/2 cup store-bought or homemade preserved horseradish
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium bowl, whisk heavy cream until thickened, but not yet at soft peaks.
Fold in crème fraîche, horseradish, chives, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Refrigerate for 30 to 60 minutes before using, or transfer to airtight container and refrigerate up to 2 weeks.

review.reviewBody: Used cream cheese instead of heavy cream as I didn't have the latter, and doubled the amount of horseradish, turned out great!

This looks delicious, but I'd omit the heavy cream. I think the horseradish flavour can stand up on its own without the richness of the whipped cream in there.

That said, a fun variation to this type of sauce is pop the cream/creme fraiche in the pan after cooking your steak, get the brown bits, add the remaining ingredients (and a dollop of dijon) and then pour as a very quick pan sauce. Almost the same ingredients and an entirely different (but also delicious) result.
Horseradish cream sauce is also a perfect accompaniment to smoked trout!

Have made my own prepared horseradish from fresh root for years and it’s truly a game-changer. Found this recipe for a standing rib roast - husband said it’s PDG (pretty damned good). That’s high praise at our table where it’s considered a sin to put anything but salt and pepper on a good steak! Going to try it out baked with chicken with a crumb coat and then on fish with dill added (I made a double batch and it’s a LOT).

I made this for our rib roast for Christmas Eve dinner and everyone loved it! This is the best horseradish cream recipe I have found over the years. Definitely a keeper and will be making it every time we make prime rib. I made it using creme fraiche and used the whole jar of Kelchner's horseradish (6.5oz).
